user-onboarding.title: User onboarding
user-onboarding.body:
## Overview of User Onboarding
Welcome to the Innovate Rwanda Admin platform. This guide is designed to help new admins quickly integrate into the platform and become productive. The onboarding process ensures smooth access to essential features for managing the innovation ecosystem.

### Detailed Steps for Onboarding
1. **Invitation or Registration**: Create an account using a work email at [Innovate Rwanda](https://innovate.uat2.techclick.rw/en). Enter your email and password, then click **Login**. Your username will appear once logged in successfully.
2. **Email Verification**: Click the verification link sent to your email. Check your spam folder or request a resend if you don’t receive it.
3. **Profile Setup**: Complete your profile by entering your name, role, and organization details. Adjust preferences such as language and time zone. Access your profile via your username → **Account**.
4. **Selecting Workspace or Role**: Choose your team or ecosystem role. Admins should select the admin role to unlock relevant features.
5. **Accessing the Admin Dashboard**: Click your username → **Dashboard**. Explore the navigation menu on the left.
6. **Quick Platform Tour**: Key sections include **Dashboard, Companies, Investors, Enablers, Opportunities**. Metrics like total users, hubs, funding, and active firms are displayed. Insights such as program role distribution, programs per hub, and project trends are available.

### Common Issues & Solutions
- **Login Problems**: Use **Forgot Password?** to reset.
- **Dashboard Access Issues**: Verify you are logged in with admin credentials.
- **Interrupted Onboarding**: Session data is saved for resuming later.

> Tip: Admins can pre-assign roles to speed up access for new users.

### Best Practices
- Explore the navigation menu for quick access.
- Keep your profile updated.
- Check dashboard metrics for ecosystem insights.

profile-setup.title: Profile setup
profile-setup.body:
## Introduction
Setting up your profile personalizes your experience on the platform and ensures account accuracy and security.

### Accessing Your Profile
Go to **Settings → Profile** or click your username → **Account**. Update your display name, avatar, job title, bio, email, password, and contact information. Configure notifications and time zone settings.

### Recommendations
- **Avatar**: Professional headshot (≥400×400 px).
- **Bio**: Concise, role-specific (e.g., “Admin for Innovative Firm”).
- **Email Verification**: Essential for security.
- **Update Details**: Save changes after editing.

### Additional Features
- Manage multiple profiles/roles with different access levels.
- View assigned roles dictating permissions.
- Customize language, theme (light/dark), and display settings.
- Manage addresses, active sessions, bookmarks, notes, groups, subscriptions.
- **Logout**: Click **Log out** under your profile menu.

> Note: Ensure required fields are complete. Email verification is essential.

### Best Practices
- Regularly update your profile.
- Use strong passwords and enable security features.
- Customize themes and preferences for comfort and productivity.

user-registration.title: User registration
user-registration.body:
## Overview
New users can register via **admin invitation** or **self-signup** (if enabled). Registration ensures secure access to platform features.

### Registration Options
- **Invitation-Based**: Admin invites users via email.
- **Self-Signup**: Direct registration if allowed.

### Step-by-Step
1. Navigate to [Innovate Rwanda](https://innovate.uat2.techclick.rw/en).
2. Provide first name, last name, phone, email, and create a strong password.
3. Optionally upload a profile image.
4. Click **Create Account**.

### Verification & Login
- Verify email via the confirmation link.
- Login using email and password. Use **Forgot Password?** if needed.

### Post-Registration Configuration
- Set preferences: language, time zone.
- Select ecosystem role (e.g., admin).
- Access the Dashboard via your username → **Dashboard**.

### Social Sign-In Options
- If enabled, use Google, LinkedIn, GitHub, etc., for registration.

### Common Issues
- **No Verification Email**: Check spam or request resend.
- **Invalid Credentials**: Match registration info.
- **Role Restrictions**: Contact admin for access issues.

> Tip: Use strong passwords. Admins can reset passwords via the Users section.

setting-preferences.title: Setting preferences
setting-preferences.body:
## Introduction
Customizing preferences improves usability and efficiency. Access via **Settings → Preferences**.

### Key Options
- **Language**: Choose preferred language.
- **Time Zone**: Set local time zone.
- **Theme**: Toggle light/dark mode via the icon next to notifications.
- **Display Settings**: Adjust table/list density, customize columns.
- **Notifications**: Configure alerts for system updates or events.

### Integration
- Preferences are linked to roles for admin-specific views.
- Align with security settings (session timeouts, login monitoring).
- Preferences may affect messaging or feed displays.

### Updating Preferences
1. Navigate to **Settings → Preferences**.
2. Modify options.
3. Click **Save** and refresh if needed.

### Best Practices
- Test changes in a non-critical session.
- Set notification digests to avoid overload.
- Align theme with working environment.

company-registration.title: Company registration steps
company-registration.body:
## Overview
Add companies to the ecosystem directory via **Companies → Directory** to enable tracking and collaboration.

### Step-by-Step
1. Navigate to **Directory → Create Company**.
2. Enter basic info: legal name, sector, location, contacts, logo URL, description, incorporation number, stage, status, founded year.
3. Add optional details: pitch deck, links, milestones, metrics, revenue, jobs, patents.
4. Submit for review if moderation is enabled.

### Post-Registration Management
- **View Details**: Eye icon for overview.
- **Edit Company**: Pencil icon, save changes.
- **Delete Company**: Trash icon, confirm deletion.

### Best Practices
- Ensure accurate info for searchability.
- Link companies to enablers or investors.
- Use search bar to avoid duplicates.
- Customize table columns for efficiency.
- Bulk import for multiple entries.

> Note: Admins can see KPIs like total companies, employees, and funding metrics.

password-reset.title: Password reset guide
password-reset.body:
## Introduction to Password Reset
Resetting your password is essential for maintaining account security, especially if forgotten or compromised. This guide provides detailed steps for the process.

### Step-by-Step Reset Process
1. **Access Login Page**: Go to [Innovate Rwanda](https://innovate.uat2.techclick.rw/en) and click **Forgot password**.
2. **Enter Email**: Provide your registered email and submit to receive a reset link.
3. **Set New Password**: Follow the link and create a strong password (at least 12 characters, including mixed case, numbers, and symbols).

### Admin-Assisted Reset
- Admins can initiate resets for users via the **Users** section or role permissions.

### Additional Guidance
- Reset links expire for security; request a new one if needed.
- After resetting, log in and update your profile or verify email.
- Enable 2FA for added protection.
- Check sessions in your profile to log out suspicious devices.
- Update password directly in admin profile under account settings.

### Common Errors and Solutions
- **Invalid Link**: Use the most recent email link.
- **Weak Password**: Follow strength requirements.
- **No Email Received**: Check spam or contact support.
- **Role Restrictions**: Ensure your role permits password management.

> Tip: Regularly update passwords and use unique ones for different platforms to enhance security.

enable-2fa.title: Enable 2FA
enable-2fa.body:
## Overview of Two-Factor Authentication
Enabling 2FA adds an extra layer of security to your Innovate Rwanda account, protecting against unauthorized access.

### Setup Steps for 2FA
1. **Navigate to Security**: Go to **Settings → Security**.
2. **Enable Option**: Locate and activate the 2FA feature (may require admin privileges).
3. **Scan QR Code**: Use a TOTP app (e.g., Authy, Google Authenticator) to scan the provided QR code.
4. **Verify Code**: Enter the generated code to confirm setup.
5. **Save Recovery Codes**: Store the displayed recovery codes securely.

### Benefits of 2FA
- Enhances protection beyond passwords.
- Integrates with email verification, session management, and login logs.

### Troubleshooting 2FA Issues
- **Lost Device**: Use recovery codes to access and reconfigure.
- **Sync Problems**: Ensure your device's time is accurate.
- **Disabling 2FA**: Requires admin approval or support assistance.
- **Option Not Visible**: Check role permissions in **Settings → Security → Roles**.

> Note: 2FA is recommended for all users, especially admins handling sensitive data. Combine with strong passwords and regular session reviews.

login-activity.title: Check login activity
login-activity.body:
## Monitoring Login Activity
Regularly reviewing login activity helps detect and prevent unauthorized access to your account.

### Accessing Login Logs
- Navigate to **Settings → Security → Logs** or profile sessions to view recent sign-ins, IP addresses, and device information.

### Detailed Activity View
- Logs display login times, locations, and devices, mirroring the sessions section in profiles.
- Identify suspicious activity, such as logins from unknown locations.

### Available Actions
- Log out from specific sessions to secure your account.
- Set up notifications for new login alerts.
- Export logs for detailed auditing.

### Best Practices for Security
- Review logs frequently, especially after password changes.
- Combine with 2FA and session timeouts for comprehensive protection.
- Admins can access platform-wide logs in the Security section.
- If unusual activity is detected, reset your password and contact support immediately.

> Tip: Use this feature with device management to maintain account integrity.

session-timeout.title: Session timeout settings
session-timeout.body:
## Configuring Session Timeouts
Session timeouts automatically log out inactive users, preventing unauthorized access.

### Default and Custom Settings
- The default idle timeout is 30 minutes.
- Admins can adjust this per workspace in **Settings → Security**.

### Configuration Steps
- Set timeout duration based on security needs (shorter for sensitive data).
- View active sessions with details in profile or security logs.

### Impact on User Experience
- Protects against access on unattended devices.
- Requires re-login after timeout, potentially with 2FA.

### Advanced Options
- Customize timeouts for different roles via permissions.
- Monitor effectiveness through login activity logs.
- Integrate with device management for enhanced security.

> Note: Balance security with usability; too short timeouts may frustrate users, too long increase risk.

login-devices.title: Managing login devices
login-devices.body:
## Overview of Device Management
Managing login devices ensures only authorized devices can access your account, enhancing overall security.

### Viewing and Managing Devices
- Access via **Settings → Security → Logs** or profile sessions to see remembered devices.
- Enable device approval for new logins in high-security environments.

### Management Steps
- Review active devices with associated login details.
- Revoke access to unwanted or lost devices immediately.

### Key Features
- Device approval process verifies new devices before granting access.
- Integrates with 2FA and login activity monitoring.

### Tips for Secure Device Management
- Regularly clear old or unused devices.
- If a device is lost, revoke access and change your password.
- Admins can manage devices for other users via the Users section.

> Tip: Combine device management with session timeouts and login logs for robust security.

export-reports.title: Export reports
export-reports.body:
## Introduction to Exporting Reports
Exporting reports allows you to download data from analytics pages for further analysis or sharing.

### Export Process
- From pages like **Companies Insights**, click **Export** to choose formats (CSV/XLSX) or schedule PDF emails.

### Step-by-Step Guide
1. Select data range and apply filters (e.g., sectors, dates).
2. Choose export format: CSV for data manipulation, PDF for presentations.

### Use Cases
- Export ESO performance metrics, funding trends, or sector supports.
- Integrate with tools like Excel for advanced analysis.

### Limitations and Tips
- Large datasets may take time to process; schedule exports during off-peak hours.
- Ensure you have the necessary permissions; verify roles if access is denied.
- Combine with bulk import for end-to-end data management.

> Note: Exported reports can be shared securely using the platform's sharing features.

bulk-import.title: Bulk import data
bulk-import.body:
## Overview of Bulk Import
Bulk import allows adding multiple records at once, saving time for large datasets.

### Import Steps
1. Access the **Bulk Import** tool in directories or integrations (e.g., KoboToolbox Import).
2. Download sample CSV templates.
3. Populate the CSV with data (e.g., hub names, contacts, statuses).
4. Upload the file and map columns to fields.
5. Preview for errors and commit the import.

### Best Practices
- Validate data locally to prevent import failures.
- For ESOs, include details like facilities and metadata.
- Handle duplicates by merging or skipping entries.

### Troubleshooting Common Issues
- **Invalid Formats**: Ensure column headers match the template.
- **Partial Imports**: Review import logs for failed rows and correct them.
- **Integration Specifics**: Use Innovate Rwanda Import-Export for ecosystem-wide data.

> Tip: Bulk import is ideal for initial data population or regular updates; combine with exports for data backups.

sharing-reports.title: Sharing reports externally
sharing-reports.body:
## Secure Report Sharing
Sharing reports externally enables collaboration while maintaining data security through controlled access.

### Sharing Options
- Generate one-time or time-bound links from export menus.
- Add passwords and watermarks for PDF files.
- Set expiration dates and view limits for sensitive information like ESO impacts or performance data.

### Use Cases
- Share hub overviews or accelerator programs with external collaborators.
- Allow partners to view data without full platform access.

### Security Features
- Track views and revoke shares at any time.
- Use watermarks to deter unauthorized distribution.
- Align sharing permissions with user roles.

### Step-by-Step Sharing
1. Export the report and select sharing options.
2. Configure link settings (expiration, password).
3. Distribute the link securely.

> Note: Review content before sharing to ensure compliance with data protection policies.

archiving-data.title: Archiving old data
archiving-data.body:
## Data Archiving Policy
Archiving helps manage platform performance by moving stale data from active views while preserving it for future reference.

### Archiving Process
- Select items (e.g., old companies, investors) in directories.
- Move to archive; data becomes hidden but remains searchable in archive sections.

### Benefits of Archiving
- Improves loading times and search efficiency.
- Maintains historical records for compliance and analysis.

### Restoration Procedures
- Access the archive via settings and restore items with a single click.
- Admins control archive access and permissions.
- Use system backups for complete data recovery if needed.

> Tip: Regularly archive inactive records to keep the platform optimized; review the archive periodically for potential restorations.

report-schedules.title: Automating report schedules
report-schedules.body:
## Automating Reports
Scheduling reports ensures regular delivery of key insights without manual intervention.

### Setup Process
- In analytics pages (e.g., Insights), set frequency (weekly/monthly) and recipients.
- Customize content to include charts, tables, and summaries (e.g., ESO metrics).

### Features
- Include trends, distributions, and KPIs.
- Pause, edit, or delete schedules as required.

### Integration
- Link schedules to notifications for delivery confirmations.
- Combine with exports and backups for comprehensive data management.

### Best Practices
- Schedule reports during low-usage periods to avoid performance impacts.
- Review scheduled content regularly to ensure relevance.

> Note: Automated reports support proactive decision-making by providing timely, actionable data.

add-team-members.title: Add team members
add-team-members.body:
## Adding Team Members
Inviting new team members expands collaboration capabilities on the platform.

### Invitation Process
- Navigate to **Users → Invite**.
- Enter emails and assign roles (e.g., Viewer, Editor, Admin).
- Invitees receive links to register and verify their accounts.

### Management Features
- Track pending invitations and resend if necessary.
- Group users by roles for organized management.
- Adjust roles post-invitation via **Settings → Security → Roles**.

### Tips for Effective Team Addition
- Use groups to manage users with similar roles.
- Ensure new members complete the onboarding process.
- Monitor activity after adding team members.

> Note: Pre-assign roles to streamline access and maintain operational clarity.

role-permissions.title: Role-based permissions
role-permissions.body:
## Understanding Role-Based Permissions
Roles define access levels and permissions, ensuring users have the appropriate capabilities.

### Standard Roles
- **User**: Basic read and limited write access.
- **Admin**: Manage content, users, and settings.
- **Superadmin**: Full platform-wide control.

### Detailed Permissions
- **System Roles**: Investor, Company Admin, etc.
- **Ecosystem Roles**: Program Facilitator, Educator, etc.
- **Permissions List**: Access to settings, user management, content editing, etc.

### Assignment and Management
- Assign roles during onboarding or in profiles.
- View roles in the Roles tab.
- Create or edit roles in **Settings → Security → Roles**: Name the role, select permissions, and submit.
- Edit or delete existing roles as needed.

### Auditing and Customization
- Track changes via activity logs.
- Fine-tune permissions per module for enhanced security.

> Tip: Regularly review roles to align with organizational needs and maintain compliance.

real-time-commenting.title: Real-time commenting
real-time-commenting.body:
## Using Real-Time Commenting
Real-time commenting enables collaborative discussions directly on platform content.

### Commenting Usage
- Mention users with @username in profiles, programs, or overviews.
- Use threaded comments for organized discussions on performance tabs or partnerships.

### Key Features
- Live updates and syncing across all users.
- Notifications for mentions to keep participants engaged.

### Best Practices
- Use comments for feedback on ESO impacts or services.
- Resolve threads to close discussions and maintain clarity.
- Integrate with other collaboration tools for comprehensive interactions.

> Note: Keep comments professional and relevant to maximize teamwork efficiency.

notifications.title: Notification settings
notifications.body:
## Configuring Notifications
Notifications keep you informed of platform activities and updates.

### Configuration Options
- Access via profile notifications or the ring bell icon.
- Set frequency: immediate or daily digest.

### Notification Types
- System alerts, reminders, and ESO-specific events (e.g., program changes).
- Personalize notifications in preferences for relevance.

### Management Tools
- Mark notifications as read or delete old ones.
- Test settings with sample alerts.
- Admins can configure global notifications in **Settings → Notifications**.

> Tip: Customize notifications to stay updated on critical events without being overwhelmed.

slack-teams.title: Integrating Slack/Teams
slack-teams.body:
## Setting Up Integrations with Slack/Teams
Integrating with Slack or Microsoft Teams allows seamless delivery of notifications to team channels.

### Setup Steps
- Navigate to **Settings → Integrations** and authorize the app.
- Select channels and configure modules (e.g., opportunities, updates).

### Key Features
- Push activity summaries and alerts for new programs or performance changes.
- Support for two-way synchronization if available.

### Troubleshooting
- If disconnected, revoke and re-authorize access.
- Verify bot permissions in the integrated app.
- Use similar processes for other integrations like Zapier for advanced workflows.

> Note: Integrations centralize communications, improving team productivity.

system-status.title: Check system status
system-status.body:
## Monitoring System Status
Regularly checking system status helps you stay informed about platform availability and any ongoing issues.

### Accessing Status Information
- Navigate to **Support → System Status** to view real-time uptime and incident history.

### Monitoring Features
- Check current status and past downtime logs.
- Subscribe to email notifications for updates on outages or maintenance.

### Use Cases
- Verify system status before performing critical actions like bulk imports or report exports.
- Report new issues if the status indicates potential problems.

### Additional Resources
- Link with emergency contacts for immediate escalation.
- Access detailed logs in **Settings → Security → Logs** for deeper analysis.

> Tip: Frequent checks help plan activities around maintenance windows and minimize disruptions.

emergency-contacts.title: Emergency contacts
emergency-contacts.body:
## Emergency Support Contacts
Use these contacts for critical issues to get prompt assistance.

### Contact Details
- **Email**: support@example.org
- **Phone**: +250 700 000 000
- **Service Level Agreement (SLA)**: P1 issues resolved within 2 hours, P2 within 8 hours, P3 by the next business day.

### When to Contact
- Urgent problems like login failures, data loss, or system outages.
- Provide detailed information: screenshots, URLs, and steps to reproduce the issue.

### Support Process
- Choose your preferred contact method.
- Track your ticket status in the support portal.

### Alternative Options
- For non-urgent queries, refer to ask-question articles.
- Use the 'Get in Touch' button in the support section.

> Note: Include as much detail as possible to expedite resolution.

ask-question-1.title: Ask a question or describe an issue (1)
ask-question-1.body:
## Submitting a Support Question
Provide a clear description of your issue to receive effective assistance.

### Submission Guidelines
- Be specific: e.g., 'I can't edit hub details—receiving error message X'.
- Include relevant context like your role, module affected, and recent actions.

### Expected Response
- Support will respond within the SLA timeframe.
- Follow up if additional information is required.

> Tip: Clear and precise descriptions lead to faster resolution.

ask-question-2.title: Ask a question or describe an issue (2)
ask-question-2.body:
## Enhanced Support Query Submission
Including visual aids helps support understand and resolve issues more effectively.

### Reporting with Details
- Attach screenshots or screen recordings of errors.
- Note your browser and version for technical issues.

### Benefits
- Visual aids allow support to diagnose and respond more quickly.

> Note: Use this method for complex issues requiring evidence or detailed context.

ask-question-3.title: Ask a question or describe an issue (3)
ask-question-3.body:
## Follow-Up Support Queries
For ongoing issues, support provides email follow-ups.

### Follow-Up Process
- Provide your email to receive detailed responses.
- Check spam/junk folders if no reply is received.

### Escalation
- For urgent matters, use the emergency contacts listed in the support section.
- Reference previous tickets to help support track your issue efficiently.

> Tip: Always include ticket IDs or previous correspondence for clarity in follow-ups.

keyboard-shortcuts.title: Keyboard shortcuts
keyboard-shortcuts.body:
## Utilizing Keyboard Shortcuts
Keyboard shortcuts improve navigation and efficiency across the platform.

### Common Shortcuts
- `/`: Focus on search bar.
- `g c`: Navigate to Companies section.
- `g i`: Navigate to Investors section.
- `?`: Open the help menu.

### Additional Shortcuts
- `e`: Edit the current page or item.
- `s`: Save changes.
- `n`: Create a new item (e.g., program, project).

### Customization and Learning
- Enable or disable shortcuts in **Preferences → Keyboard Shortcuts**.
- Learn more using the help overlay or platform documentation.

> Note: Shortcuts may be platform-specific; test them in your environment.

api-access.title: API access
api-access.body:
## Accessing the API
The API enables programmatic interactions with the platform for automation and integrations.

### Getting Started
- Request an API key in **Settings → Integrations**.
- Keys include scopes (read/write) and have rate limits.

### API Documentation
- Endpoints are available for profiles, dashboards, and data retrieval.
- Authenticate requests using the provided API key.

### Limits and Usage
- Default limit: 1000 calls per hour; contact support to request higher limits.
- Integrate API credentials with external tools like RDB for automation.

> Tip: Use the API to automate workflows, export/import data, and integrate with other systems.

custom-templates.title: Custom templates
custom-templates.body:
## Creating Custom Templates
Templates ensure consistent formatting in reports, messages, and content.

### Template Creation
- Access via **Content Studio → Messaging**.
- Design templates with placeholders for dynamic data.

### Usage Instructions
- Apply templates to new items for uniform appearance.
- Edit or share templates with team members as needed.

### Advanced Features
- Use HTML for styled email templates.
- Integrate templates with exports, reports, and sharing.

> Note: Keep templates updated to reflect evolving content and branding needs.

bulk-import-tools.title: Bulk import tools
bulk-import-tools.body:
## Using Bulk Import Tools
Bulk import tools enable efficient entry of multiple records simultaneously.

### Tool Overview
- Download sample CSV templates and validate data formats locally.
- Supports importing data for ESOs, companies, investors, and other records.

### Import Process
- Upload files via **Integrations → Bulk Import** (e.g., KoboToolbox).
- Map columns to platform fields, preview entries, and commit the import.
- Rollback in case of errors.

### Integration
- Combine with archiving, backups, and exports for comprehensive data management.

> Tip: Validate your data carefully before import to prevent errors; use templates for consistency.

system-backup.title: System backup options
system-backup.body:
## System Backup and Recovery
Regular backups protect against data loss and ensure recovery in case of incidents.

### Backup Options
- Daily snapshots retained for 30 days.
- Manual backups available via **Admin Settings → Backup**.
- Optional cloud storage integrations for off-site backup.

### Recovery Process
- Restore from snapshots when issues occur.
- Periodically test restores to ensure reliability.

### Best Practices
- Align backup schedules with automated reports.
- Contact support for full data exports if required.
- Maintain a secure backup environment.

> Note: Regular backups are essential for business continuity and disaster recovery planning.

companies-insights.title: Companies → Insights
companies-insights.body:
## Exploring Companies Insights
Access this section via **Companies → Insights** in the left navigation menu. It provides key statistics and visual analyses for ventures, founders, and technologies.

### Summary Metrics
- **Number of Ventures**: Total registered companies.
- **Number of Co-founders**: Total individuals involved as co-founders.
- **Average Co-founders per Venture**: Statistical average.
- **Gender Distribution**: Breakdown by gender.

### Insights and Visualizations
- **Expansion/Operating Countries**: Interactive maps showing geographical spread.
- **Technology Analysis**: Bar charts for categories like software, AI, hardware.
- **Additional Insights**: Funding trends, sector distributions (navigate via dots for more views).

### Venture Assessment Table
- Searchable table including venture name, sectors, technologies, founded year, funding, team size, climate focus, and status.
- Features: Search bar, filters (All, Active, Pending, Suspended, Deleted), column customization, three-dot menu for actions (View Assessment, View Website).
- Admins have access to advanced filters and cohort comparisons.

> Tip: Use insights to identify trends and opportunities in the company ecosystem.

investors-directory.title: Investors → Directory
investors-directory.body:
## Guide to Investors Directory
Access via **Investors → Directory** to manage and browse investor profiles, including funds, angels, and DFIs. Track investment theses, ticket sizes, and geographical focus.

### Navigation Overview
- **Add Investor Button**: Top-right corner.
- **Search Bar**: Filter investors by name or criteria.
- **Investor Table Columns**: Name (with logo), Type, Visibility, Verified status, Status, Actions (View, Edit, Delete).

### Viewing Investor Details
- Click eye icon (👁) to view sidebar with tabs: Overview, Profiles, General Info, Addresses, Preferences, Holdings, Portfolio, Instruments, Partnerships, Members, References, Impacts, Metrics, Reputations, Engagement, Feedback, Programs, Links, Resources.

### Editing Investors
1. Click pencil icon (✏️) next to the record.
2. Update fields in the form (Name, Type, Contact, etc.).
3. Click 'Save changes'.

### Deleting Investors
1. Click trash icon (🗑).
2. Confirm deletion in the popup.

### Customization
- Use 'Customize Columns' to show/hide table columns.

### Creating a New Investor
1. Click '+ Add Investor'.
2. Fill required fields (Company, Display Name, Profile Image, Email, Phone, Website, Visibility, Status, Founded Date, Investor Types).
3. Submit to create the investor.

### Best Practices
- Keep data accurate and up-to-date.
- Regularly verify profiles.
- Customize views to focus on relevant data.

> Note: Admin permissions are required for full management.

enablers-assessment.title: Enablers → Assessment
enablers-assessment.body:
## Guide to Enablers Assessment
Access via **Enablers → Assessment** to evaluate ESOs like hubs and incubators using scorecards and KPIs (programs, jobs, cohorts, capital).

### Assessment Interface
- **ESO Insight Data**: Charts for supported vs. pipeline startups, job creation, program linkages.
- **Assessment Table**: Columns for full name, email/phone, organization, actions; includes filters, column customization, and search.
- **View Person Data**: Details include contact, organization, years operational, mission, ecosystem role, supported sectors/services, flagship programs.

### Managing Hubs
- Navigate to **Enablers → Hubs**.
- Table: Organization, founded year, contact, status, actions; includes search and column customization.
- **Add New Hub**: Enter basic info (name, logo, description), contact/status (email, phone, website, capacity, year, operational status), facilities/metadata.
- **Actions**: View details, edit, visit website.
- Preview and confirm before creation.

> Tip: Use assessments to track ESO performance and impact.

opportunities-tenders.title: Opportunities → Tenders
opportunities-tenders.body:
## Managing Tenders in Opportunities
Access via **Opportunities → Tenders** to publish and manage RFPs/RFQs.

### Tender Management
- List columns: Name, budget, category, status, published/updated dates, actions.
- **View Website**: Direction icon.
- **View Details**: Eye icon for overview (contact, deadline, budget, sectors), info (edit/delete), engagement (add/edit/delete).
- **Edit Tender**: Update details and save.
- **Delete Tender**: Confirm deletion.
- **Create Tender**: Fill form and submit.

### Features
- Set deadlines, criteria, and evaluations.
- Send notifications for updates.
- Link tenders to programs or events.
- Use search for efficient management.

> Note: Tenders facilitate vendor bids and administrative awards.

content-studio-basics.title: Content Studio → Basics
content-studio-basics.body:
## Basics of Content Studio
Manage site content, messaging, feeds, and more via **Content Studio**.

### Site Management
- Edit sections like Hero, About.
- Select section/language, update title, subtitle, animations.
- Preview and save changes (auto-save supported).

### Messaging Tools
- Manage templates and campaigns.
- Preview and edit templates (subject, body, placeholders).
- Use HTML for styled content.

### Additional Tools
- WYSIWYG editor for easy editing.
- Version control for tracking changes.

### Use Cases
- Customize ESO overviews or newsroom content.
- Maintain consistent messaging across the platform.

> Tip: Use Content Studio for all content-related updates.
